poem:
"Chrissie - A Derbyshire Lament"

Chrissie, once vibrant as daffodils in spring,
Dimmed too soon in Derbyshire's cold grasp.
Greenhill Lane whispers your name, echoing loss,
While constables chase shadows from the past.
Words fall short, your absence vast and deep,
In the hearts that you'd touch, your memory seeps. 
Paramedics fought time, but it was late;
Now in heaven's arms, for us, you wait.
